column2: Learned  Counsel  for the  Appellant  citing  the  judgment of Jayathilaka  Vs.  A.G.  1

column1:
SLR  2003  page  No.  107  argued 
that  the
column2: learned  High  Court  Judge  has  not

column1: considered  the  state  of intoxication  of the  deceased  and  the Appellant.  There  is
no  evidence  to  say  that  the  deceased  was  under  the  influence  of  liquor.
Post  Mortem  Report  indicates that "alcohol  smell  is  not clear."  The  Appellant  in
his evidence did  not say that he was  intoxicated at the time of the incident.
